metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4555 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in ecrire/action/logout.php in SPIP before 2.1.24 allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of arbitrary users for requests that logout the user via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.0.14-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spip package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.14-1').
